contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} {{Infobox settlement |name = Soestdijk |coordinates_region = NL |subdivision_type = [[List of sovereign states|Country]] |subdivision_name = [[Netherlands]] |subdivision_type1 = Province |subdivision_name1 = Utrecht (province) |subdivision_type2 = Municipality |subdivision_name2 = [[Soest (Nederland)|Soest]] / [[Baarn]] |area_km2 = |population = |population_as_of = |density = |website = |image_shield = |latNS = N |longEW = E |latd = 52 |latm = 11 |lats = 27 |longd = 5 |longm = 16 |longs = 56 }} '''Soestdijk''' ({{IPA-nl|suzˈdɛik}}) was a village in the municipality of [[Soest, Netherlands|Soest]], [[Utrecht (province)|Utrecht]], [[Netherlands]] and gives its name to [[Soestdijk Palace|Paleis Soestdijk]], which from 1937 to 2004 was the residence of Princess and later [[Queen Juliana]] and [[Prince Bernhard]] (who both died in 2004). Most of Soestdijk is now a part of the city of Soest. A smaller part of the former village, including the palace, is part of the municipality of [[Baarn]]. {{Dutch municipality Soest}} {{Coord|52|11|37|N|5|16|45|E|region:NL_type:city|display=title}} [[Category:Populated places in Utrecht (province)]] {{Utrecht-geo-stub}}
